what: Import, Filter and Visualize Data from Mitemap
title: Import, Filter and Visualize Data from Mitemap
Import, Filter and Visualize Data from Mitemap
text: can install development version MiteMapTools GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("adrientaudiere/MiteMapTools")

title: Import, Filter and Visualize Data from Mitemap
text: basic example shows solve common problem:  input folder MiteMapTools consist - metadata file (xlsx csv) 8 columns: - Run number - File name (must present list zip files) - Date - Start time - Farm - MiteMap number - Bag - Modality time second (position recorded every 0.2s) position x (mm) position y (mm) Boolean variable indicating individual remained immobile since last record (1 immobile) png file figuring position individual using heatmap date hour experiment name MiteMap run Total time spent half containing odor source (second) Total time spent opposite half (second) Time spent immobile half containing odor source (second) Time spent immobile opposite half (second)  Total distance traveled opposite half (mm) date hour experiment name MiteMap run Total time spent half containing odor source (second) Total time spent opposite half (second) Time spent immobile half containing odor source (second) Time spent immobile opposite half (second)  Total distance traveled opposite half (mm)
code: library(MiteMapTools) #> Le chargement a nécessité le package : tidyverse #> ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── #> ✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5 #> ✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1 #> ✔ ggplot2   3.5.2     ✔ tibble    3.2.1 #> ✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1 #> ✔ purrr     1.0.4      #> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── #> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag() #> ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors #> Le chargement a nécessité le package : readxl  MM_filtered_centered <- filter_mitemap(MM_example, center_x = -20, center_y = -20) #> Row removed when clearing the first secondes: 536 #> Row removed when clearing bad x range: 16860 #> Row removed when clearing bad y range: 0 #> Row removed when clearing bad x values: 24537 #> Row removed when clearing bad y values: 93 #> Row removed when clearing for run with times sup to maximum_time: 814 vioplot_mitemap(MM_filtered_centered)

what: example dataset from MiteMapTools for shape Half-half — HH_example
title: example dataset from MiteMapTools for shape Half-half — HH_example
text: Obtained using code : mm_HH <- suppressWarnings(import_mitemap(system.file("extdata", "POUL6", package = "MiteMapTools"), type_of_files = "HH"))

title: example dataset from MiteMapTools for shape Half-half — HH_example
code: data(HH_example)

title: example dataset from MiteMapTools for shape Half-half — HH_example
text: list 4 elements resulting_data: (possibly huge) tibble metadata information position x, y time. files_not_in_csv: list files present csv filenames zip files. files_not_in_metada: list files funded metadata. duplicate_file_name_in_metadata: list duplicated file names metadata. resulting_data slot structured 16 columns (fifth ones zip files metadata files). See import_mitemap(). File_name Date hour name MiteMap (can redundant MiteMap_number) Total time spent half containing odor source (second) Total time spent opposite half (second) Time spent immobile half containing odor source (second) Time spent immobile opposite half (second) Total distance traveled half containing odor source (mm) Total distance traveled opposite half (mm) Boolean variable indicating individual remained immobile since last record (1 immobile) Run number Date Start time Farm MiteMap number Bag Modality

what: Test binomial on MiteMap for presence in the half part of the odor — binom_test_mitemap

text: test run Modality values Farm p-adjustement step.

title: Test binomial on MiteMap for presence in the half part of the odor — binom_test_mitemap
code: binom_test_mitemap(MiteMap, modality = "Modality", p.adjust_method = "BH")

title: Test binomial on MiteMap for presence in the half part of the odor — binom_test_mitemap
text: MiteMap (required) result import_mitemap ($resulting_data) raw_data modality modality separate test p.adjust_method method p-adjustement. See p.adjust()

title: Test binomial on MiteMap for presence in the half part of the odor — binom_test_mitemap
Test binomial on MiteMap for presence in the half part of the odor — binom_test_mitemap
Test binomial on MiteMap for presence in the half part of the odor — binom_test_mitemap
code: binom_test_mitemap(HH_example$resulting_data) #> # A tibble: 6 × 10 #> # Groups:   Farm [2] #>   Farm     Modality     n    HH   yes    no p.value p.value.adj estimate CI      #>   <chr>    <fct>    <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>       <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>   #> 1 POUL6_D1 G           31 0.129     4    27   0.001       0.003    0.129 0.036 … #> 2 POUL6_D1 NM          31 0.129     4    27   0.001       0.003    0.129 0.036 … #> 3 POUL6_D1 T           31 0.387    12    19   0.281       0.337    0.387 0.218 … #> 4 POUL6_P1 G           29 0.207     6    23   0.002       0.004    0.207 0.08 -… #> 5 POUL6_P1 NM          28 0.214     6    22   0.004       0.006    0.214 0.083 … #> 6 POUL6_P1 T           27 0.519    14    13   1           1        0.519 0.319 … binom_test_mitemap(HH_example$resulting_data, p.adjust_method = "bonferroni") #> # A tibble: 6 × 10 #> # Groups:   Farm [2] #>   Farm     Modality     n    HH   yes    no p.value p.value.adj estimate CI      #>   <chr>    <fct>    <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>       <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>   #> 1 POUL6_D1 G           31 0.129     4    27   0.001       0.006    0.129 0.036 … #> 2 POUL6_D1 NM          31 0.129     4    27   0.001       0.006    0.129 0.036 … #> 3 POUL6_D1 T           31 0.387    12    19   0.281       1        0.387 0.218 … #> 4 POUL6_P1 G           29 0.207     6    23   0.002       0.012    0.207 0.08 -… #> 5 POUL6_P1 NM          28 0.214     6    22   0.004       0.024    0.214 0.083 … #> 6 POUL6_P1 T           27 0.519    14    13   1           1        0.519 0.319 …

what: Map convex hull on MiteMap — convex_hull_mitemap
title: Map convex hull on MiteMap — convex_hull_mitemap
Map convex hull on MiteMap — convex_hull_mitemap
code: convex_hull_mitemap(   MiteMap,   unity = 1,   tbe = 3,   plot_show = TRUE,   probs_quantile = 0.68,   min_nb_spatial_points = 2,   each_point_count_one = FALSE,   hull_col = "red",   plot_center_of_mass = TRUE )

title: Map convex hull on MiteMap — convex_hull_mitemap
text: MiteMap (required) result import_mitemap ($resulting_data) raw_data unity (default = 1): size square grid mm tbe (default = 3) plot_show (Logical, default = TRUE) : plot mitemap ? probs_quantile (default = 0.68) min_nb_spatial_points : Minimum number spatial point keep sample each_point_count_one (Logical ; default = FALSE) hull_col color hull area plot_center_of_mass (Logical, default = TRUE): plot center mass?

title: Filter MiteMap result — filter_mitemap
Filter MiteMap result — filter_mitemap
code: filter_mitemap(   MiteMap,   HH = NULL,   CH = NULL,   first_seconds_to_delete = 2,   bad_range_value_x = 50,   bad_range_value_y = 50,   max_x_value = 42,   min_x_value = 0,   max_y_value = 42,   min_y_value = 0,   maximum_time = 603,   center_x = 0,   center_y = 0 )

title: Filter MiteMap result — filter_mitemap
text: MiteMap (required) result import_mitemap ($resulting_data) raw_data HH result import_mitemap() ($resulting_data) type_of_files = "HH". remove run () time <0, time <0 time_in/(time_in + time_out) > 1 HH files. CH result import_mitemap() ($resulting_data) type_of_files = "CH". remove run () time <0, time <0 time_in/(time_in + time_out) > 1 CH files. first_seconds_to_delete (default: 2) many seconds need delete? bad_range_value_x (default: 42) range value x superior expect. param filter values File_name basis. bad_range_value_y (default: 42) range value y superior expect. param filter values File_name basis. max_x_value (default: 42) Maximum value x axis. param filter values point (one line) basis. min_x_value (default: 0) Minimum value x axis. param filter values point (one line) basis. max_y_value (default: 42) Maximum value y axis. param filter values point (one line) basis. min_y_value (default: 0) Minimum value y axis. param filter values point (one line) basis. maximum_time (default: 603) Maximum time one run (seconds)). center_x (int, default 0) Center value x additioning center_x mm x.mm. center_y (int, default 0) Center value y additioning center_y mm y.mm.

title: Filter MiteMap result — filter_mitemap
Filter MiteMap result — filter_mitemap

what: Get the extension of a file — get_file_extension
title: Get the extension of a file — get_file_extension
text: Internally used rename_files_with_number() ex. Warning: work '.' name file extension

title: Get the extension of a file — get_file_extension
code: get_file_extension(file_path)

title: Get the extension of a file — get_file_extension
Get the extension of a file — get_file_extension
Get the extension of a file — get_file_extension
Get the extension of a file — get_file_extension
code: get_file_extension("my_file.csv") #> [1] "csv" get_file_extension("my.file.csv") #> Warning: There is more than one '.' inside your file path: my.file.csv #> [1] "file" "csv"  get_file_extension("my_file.csv.zip") #> Warning: There is more than one '.' inside your file path: my_file.csv.zip #> [1] "csv" "zip"

title: Import MiteMapTools data — import_mitemap
Import MiteMapTools data — import_mitemap
code: import_mitemap(   path_to_folder,   path_to_metadata = NULL,   format_metadata = "csv",   type_of_files = "raw_data",   delete_parenthesis = FALSE,   replace_parenthesis = TRUE,   delete_space = TRUE,   messages = TRUE,   csv_with_correction = FALSE,   remove_csv_folder = TRUE,   dec = ",",   force = FALSE,   skip = 1,   colnames_metadata = c("Run_number", "File_name", "Date", "Start_time", "Farm",     "MiteMap_number", "Bag", "Modality") )

title: Import MiteMapTools data — import_mitemap
text: path_to_folder Path folder zip files containing csv one metadata files .xlsx format path_to_metadata Path csv file (xlsx format_metadata="xlsx"). one csv file set path_to_metadata="csv" ("xlsx"). Need set using complete path csv file file folder multiple xlsx/csv files folder. format_metadata Either csv xlsx type_of_files (default : "raw_data") pattern select type csv (either "raw_data", "CH" "HH") files inside zip files. delete_parenthesis (Logical, default FALSE) delete parenthesis number inside name files. Note name csv inside zip file parenthesis parenthesis name. Thus default value TRUE recommended either delete_parenthesis replace_parenthesis replace_parenthesis (Logical, default TRUE) Replace xxx(1) xxx_1 delete_space (Logical, default TRUE) messages (Logical, default TRUE) print warnings? csv_with_correction (Logical, default FALSE) TRUE present zip files, position files correction (center reduce 0) used. remove_csv_folder (Logical, default TRUE) FALSE, csv_folder kept. May useful debugging. dec decimal csv metadata files. force Force overwriting path csv_folder skip (default 1) skip first line metadata files. colnames_metadata Column names metadata column. Note File_name required must correspond names zip files.

title: Import MiteMapTools data — import_mitemap
text: list 4 elements resulting_data: (possibly huge) tibble metadata information position x, y time. files_not_in_csv: list files present csv filenames zip files. files_not_in_metada: list files funded metadata. duplicate_file_name_in_metadata: list duplicated file names metadata. default, resulting_data slot structured 12 columns (fifth ones zip files metadata files). File_name time second (position recorded every 0.2s) position x (mm) position y (mm) Boolean variable indicating individual remained immobile since last record (1 immobile) Run number Date Start time Farm MiteMap number Bag Modality

title: Import MiteMapTools data — import_mitemap
Import MiteMapTools data — import_mitemap
code: mm_csv <- suppressWarnings(import_mitemap(   system.file("extdata", "POUL6", package = "MiteMapTools") )) #>  #> The final number of samples for folder is 117721. dim(mm_csv$resulting_data) #> [1] 117721     12  mm_HH <- suppressWarnings(import_mitemap(   system.file("extdata", "POUL6", package = "MiteMapTools"),   type_of_files = "HH" )) #>  #> The final number of samples for folder is 43. dim(mm_HH$resulting_data) #> [1] 43 16  mm_xlsx <- suppressWarnings(import_mitemap(   system.file("extdata", "POUL6", package = "MiteMapTools"),   format_metadata = "xlsx" )) #>  #> The final number of samples for folder is 117721.  dim(mm_xlsx$resulting_data) #> [1] 117721     12

code: make_heatmap(   path_to_folder,   output_path = "Heatmap",   path_to_metadata = NULL,   format_metadata = "csv",   modality = "Modality",   subfolder_by_farm = TRUE,   subfolder_by_modality = TRUE,   dec = ",",   skip = 1,   colnames_metadata = c("Run_number", "File_name", "Date", "Start_time", "Farm",     "MiteMap_number", "Bag", "Modality"),   force = FALSE )

title: Create folder(s) with heatmap — make_heatmap
text: path_to_folder Path folder output_path (default =  "Heatmap") path_to_metadata Path metadata format_metadata (either csv xlsx) modality (character, default "Modality") Set column names create subfolder levels modality subfolder_by_farm (Logical, default = TRUE) create subfolder farm subfolder_by_modality (Logical, default = TRUE) create subfolder modality set parameter modality dec decimal csv metadata files. skip (default 1) skip first line metadata files. colnames_metadata Column names metadata column. Note File_name required must correspond names zip files. force Force overwriting path output_path

title: Plot individual map — plot_ind_mitemap
text: MiteMap MiteMap (required) result import_mitemap ($resulting_data) raw_data ind_index (required, vector int, default = c(1)) index numbers file(s) (individual(s)) want plot time_animation (logical, default FALSE) plot animate using gganimate ? add_base_circle (logical, default FALSE) base circle plot ? center_base_circle (int) center base circle. used center_base_circle TRUE. breaks_animation (int) number breaks animation. used time_animation TRUE. diameter_base_circle (int) diameter base circle. used center_base_circle TRUE. npoints_base_circle (int) number point draw base circle. used center_base_circle TRUE. linewidth (int) linewidth path alpha_shadow (int 0,1) Alpha value (transparency) shadow path. used time_animation` TRUE.
